lines.text: I'm an angel. I kill firstborns while their mamas watch. I turn cities into salt. I even, when I feel like it, rip the souls from little girls, and from now till kingdom come, the only thing you can count on in your existence is never understanding why.

Did you ever notice how in the Bible, when ever God needed to punish someone, or make an example, or whenever God needed a killing, he sent an angel? Did you ever wonder what a creature like that must be like? A whole existence spent praising your God, but always with one wing dipped in blood. Would you ever really want to see an angel?
"Even now in Heaven there are Angles carrying savage weapons."
Do you know how you got that dent, in your top lip? Way back, before you were born, I told you a secret, then I put my finger there and I said "Shhhhh!"
Some people lose their faith because Heaven shows them too little. But how many people lose their faith because Heaven showed them too much?
If you wanted to prove your side was right, Gabriel, so badly, why didn't you just ask Him? Why didn't you ask God?
Because He doesn't talk to me any more.

Do you know what Hell really is, Thomas? It's not lakes of burning oil or chains of ice. It's being removed from God's sight, having His Word taken from you. It's hard to believe. so hard. I know that better than anyone.
I can lay you out and fill your mouth with your mother's feces, or we can talk.
Study your math, kids. Key to the Universe.
You see, I'm not here to help you little bitch because I love you or because I care for you, but because two hells is one hell too many, and I can't have that.

Other angels have made this war because they hate you, you and all humans. God has put you in his grace and pushed them aside. They're desperate. They've never been able to conquer the other loyal angels, and so this war has remained in stalemate for thousands of years. And while this state of affairs endures no soul can meet its god. Your parents, and their parents, and so on from the beginning lie still in wormy earth. Of course, some of them do come to me eventually, for while heaven may be closed I am always open, even on Christmas.
Little Tommy Daggett. How I loved listening to your sweet prayers every night. And then you'd jump in your bed, so afraid I was under there. And I was!
Humans... and how I love you talking monkeys for this... know more about war and treachery of the spirit than any angel.
Do you believe that you are a part of God's plan?
That's a complicated question.
No it isn't.
Go to hell!
Heaven, darling. Heaven. At least get the zip code right.
It's all the same to you, isn't it?
No. In heaven, we believe in love.
What do you love, Gabriel?
Cracking your skull.
Jerry, come here. If you were a soul, where would you hide?
The hell away from you.
Oh, Gabriel. When was it that you lost your grace?
Who are you?
That's a long story.
[first lines]

I remember the First War, the way the sky burned, the faces of angels destroyed. I saw a third of Heaven's legion banished and the creation of Hell. I stood with my brothers and watched Lucifer Fall. But now my brothers are not brothers, and we have come here where we are mortal to steal the Dark Soul, not yet Lucifer's, to serve our cause. I have always obeyed, but I never thought the War would happen again.
[Thomas has refused Lucifer's offer to "come home" with him]
I have my soul. I have my faith. What do you have, angel?
Leave the light on, Thomas.

[thumbing through ancient Bible found on the dead John Doe]
Cute.
What is it?
Twenty-third chapter of Saint John's Revelations.
And?
There is no twenty-third chapter.
Well, maybe this is the Teacher's Edition.
Eternity here in that sagging skin suit, or one more day with me?
Why?
Can't drive. But I can wait. Until stars burn out if you don't make up your mind.
This war is mine!
Your war is arrogance. That makes it evil. That's mine.
Lucifer. Sitting in your basement. Sulking over your break up with the boss. You're nothing.
Time to come home, Gabriel.
God? God is love. I don't love you.
It's not here.
Bad news for the war effort.
Shut up!

[shrill whisper]
I love you! I love you more than Jesus!
I was the first angel, loved once above all others...
[singing]
But like all true love... one day it withered on the vine...
[last lines]

[narrating]
And in the end, I think it must be about faith, and if faith is a choice, then it can be lost - for a man, an angel, or the devil himself. And if faith means never completely understanding God's plan, then maybe understanding just a part of it - our part - is what it is to have a soul. And maybe in the end, that's what being human is, after all.
And this is for you. He's also a hermaphrodite.
[lifts the sheet covering the corpse so Thomas can see]
He's got both male and female sex organs.
Think of the possibilities!
Yeah, you can be impotent and frigid all at the same time.
I'm so tired of this war.
Reject the lie Simon. Join us! Help us make it like it was before the monkeys. You remember? We cast out Lucifer's army, you and I. We threw their rebel thrones from the wall.
They wanted to be gods.
I don't wanna be a god Simon. I just wanna make it like it was, before the lie. When he loved us best.
[Thomas has just killed Jerry]
Pest! You have any idea how hard it is to get one of those?
When was he buried?
Which time?
You can't HAVE HER!
You know what Hell really is Thomas? It's not lakes of burning oil or chains of ice. It's being removed from God's sight. It's hard to believe... so hard.
Think, Thomas, think. What is the one thing essential to an angel... the thing that holds his entire being together?
Faith, faith, faith.
And what would happen if that faith was tested and an angel, just like you didn't understand? Use that. Use it!
It's a big universe Jerry and some things in it are talking monkey work. Monkeys, like you.
Never trust a fucking angel.
